All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AlreadyPickedException
 
Bookshelf
The bookshelf class represents personal bookshelf of each player
CardsBag
CardsBag class represents the physical bag in the game, containing all the tiles that are then placed on the LivingRoomBoard
ClientApp
ClientApp class is the one that runs on client side during the game
ClientConnection
Interface used to connect with client
ClientGUI
ClientGUI defines the behaviour of the Client when user choose GUI to play
ClientSceneController
 
ClientTUI
This class is used when the client plays through the CLI (TUI)
CommonGoalCard
The abstract class CommonGoalCard provides all the behaviour that are common between the 12 common goal cards
CommonGoalCard1
Common Goal Card 1: Six groups each containing at least 2 tiles of the same type.
CommonGoalCard10
Common goal card 10: Five tiles of the same type forming an X
CommonGoalCard11
Common goal card 11: Eight tiles of the same type.
CommonGoalCard11Test
 
CommonGoalCard12
Common goal card 12: Five columns of increasing or decreasing height.
CommonGoalCard2
Common goal card 2: Five tiles of the same type forming a diagonal
CommonGoalCard3
Common Goal Card 3: Four tiles of the same type in the four corners of the bookshelf
CommonGoalCard4
Common goal card 4: Four lines each formed by 5 tiles of maximum three different types.
CommonGoalCard5
Common goal card 5: Four groups each containing at least 4 tiles of the same type.
CommonGoalCard6
Common goal card 6: Two columns each formed by 6 different types of tiles
CommonGoalCard7
Common goal card 7: Two groups each containing 4 tiles of the same type in a 2x2 square.
CommonGoalCard8
Common goal card 8: Two lines each formed by 5 different types of tiles.
CommonGoalCard9
Common goal card 9: Three columns each formed by 6 tiles of maximum three different types.
CommonGoalsNumberException
Exception if CommonGoalsNumber is wrong
CommonGoalsNumberExceptionTest
 
CoordinateException
 
DifferentLengthException
 
EmptyMessageException
 
EmptyTileException
 
Game
Game class contains the actual game, identified by an id and containing all the necessary items to play
GameController
GameController is the class that acts as controller in the MVC pattern
GameSceneController
 
GameView
GameView class is meant to copy necessary attributes from game class and make it final, to pass through the network only "final" attributes and serialize them
GoalCard
The abstract class CommonGoalCard provides all the behaviour that are common between personal and common goal cards
LivingRoomBoard
LivingRoomBoard class represents the living room board on which the game is played
MaxDrawableObjectsException
 
MyShelfieApp
Main class is the class that runs as soon as the program runs, lets the user decide to run the server or the client
NoAdjacentException
 
NoFreeSidesException
 
NoStraightLineException
 
NotYourTurnException
 
ObjectCard
ObjectCard class represents the cards placed in the tiles on the LivingRoomBoard
Observable<T>
 
Observer<T>
 
OrderException
 
OutOfBookshelfException
 
PersonalGoalCard
PersonalGoalCard class represents the personal goal card in the physical game
Player
Player class represents the single player
PlayerChoice
PlayerChoice class is meant to transform to final passed parameters, to pass through the network only "final" attributes and serialize them
PlayersNumberException
Exception if PlayersNumber is wrong
PlayersNumberExceptionTest
 
PointCard
PointCard reflects the actual PointCard in the game, with a roman numeral on the back
PublicObjectCard
 
RemoteView
RemoteView handles server-side the View
RomanNumeral
RomanNumeral class allows to use roman numerals to reflect the real game
Server
Handles server side activities
ServerApp
ServerApp is the class that runs on server side during the game
SocketClientConnection
 
Tile
Tile's class represents the tiles: each square in the LivingRoomBoard that may have on top (contain) an ObjectCard
Type
Type's class is used to associate each type to a specific color and allow to refer to each type with his name
Value
Value class is used to set the value of PointCard
View
This class is used for the "View" part of the MVC pattern
WelcomeSceneController
